title: 2 John Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 2 John with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 1 chapters.

questions.question: To whom is the letter of 2 John addressed?
options: The elect lady and her children
questions.correctAnswer: The elect lady and her children
questions.explanation: The letter is addressed to the elect lady and her children, a phrase understood as a metaphor for a particular Christian house church and its members.

questions.question: What reason does the elder give for loving the elect lady and her children?
questions.explanation: The elder loves the elect lady and her children for the truth, indicating their shared commitment to the gospel truth.

questions.question: According to 2 John, what dwelleth in us and shall be with us forever?
questions.explanation: The truth is described as dwelling in believers and remaining with them eternally.

questions.question: From whom does grace, mercy, and peace come according to 2 John 1:3?
options: God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Grace, mercy, and peace are wished from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father.

questions.question: What caused the elder to rejoice greatly in 2 John 1:4?
options: That the elect lady had sent gifts
That the children walked in truth
That the church had grown in number
That the false teachers had left
questions.correctAnswer: That the children walked in truth
questions.explanation: The elder rejoiced because he found the children of the elect lady walking in truth.

questions.question: What commandment does the elder remind the elect lady of in 2 John 1:5?
questions.explanation: The elder reminds her of the commandment to love one another, which they had from the beginning.

questions.question: According to 2 John 1:6, what is the definition of love?
questions.explanation: Love is defined as walking after God's commandments, which they have heard from the beginning.

questions.question: Who are described as deceivers and antichrists in 2 John 1:7?
options: Those who deny that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh
Those who refuse to give alms
Those who do not observe the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Those who deny that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh
questions.explanation: Deceivers and antichrists are defined as those who do not confess that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh.

questions.question: What warning does the elder give in 2 John 1:8?
options: To look to yourselves, that you lose not those things you have wrought
questions.correctAnswer: To look to yourselves, that you lose not those things you have wrought
questions.explanation: The warning is to watch themselves so they do not lose what they have worked for and receive a full reward.

questions.question: What is said about anyone who transgresses and abides not in the doctrine of Christ in 2 John 1:9?
options: They shall be saved by faith
questions.explanation: Anyone who does not continue in the doctrine of Christ does not have God; but he who abides in the doctrine has both the Father and the Son.

questions.question: What instruction is given about anyone who comes and brings not the doctrine of Christ in 2 John 1:10?
options: Receive him not into your house, neither bid him God speed
Ask for proof of his teachings
questions.correctAnswer: Receive him not into your house, neither bid him God speed
questions.explanation: The elder instructs not to receive in the house or bid God speed to those who bring not the doctrine of Christ.

questions.question: What is the consequence of bidding God speed to one who brings not the doctrine of Christ according to 2 John 1:11?
options: You become partaker of his evil deeds
You will be protected from harm
questions.correctAnswer: You become partaker of his evil deeds
questions.explanation: To bid God speed to such a person is to share in his evil deeds.

questions.question: What method of communication does the elder prefer over writing in 2 John 1:12?
questions.explanation: The elder prefers to come and speak face to face rather than writing with paper and ink.

questions.question: Who sends greeting to the elect lady's children in 2 John 1:13?
options: The children of thy elect sister
questions.correctAnswer: The children of thy elect sister
questions.explanation: The children of the elect sister send greeting, indicating a related or sister church community.

questions.question: True or False: The elder says he loves the elect lady and her children only because of their wealth.
questions.explanation: The elder loves them because of the truth, not because of material wealth.

questions.question: True or False: The elder commands the elect lady to love one another as a new commandment.
questions.explanation: He says it is not a new commandment but one they have had from the beginning.

questions.question: True or False: The elder warns that many deceivers have entered into the world who do not confess Jesus Christ is come in the flesh.
questions.explanation: He warns about deceivers and antichrists denying Christ's incarnation.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 John, abiding in the doctrine of Christ means having both the Father and the Son.
questions.explanation: Those who abide in the doctrine have both God the Father and the Son.

questions.question: True or False: The elder encourages welcoming all teachers regardless of their doctrine.
questions.explanation: The elder instructs not to receive or welcome anyone who does not bring the correct doctrine of Christ.

questions.question: True or False: The elder says to be careful not to lose the things we have wrought, so that we may receive a full reward.
questions.explanation: He warns to watch ourselves to keep what we have worked for and receive a full reward.

questions.question: True or False: The elder says he has many things to write but prefers to write with ink and paper.
questions.explanation: He prefers to speak face to face rather than write with paper and ink.

questions.question: True or False: The letter of 2 John ends with 'Amen.'
questions.explanation: The final word of the letter is 'Amen,' affirming the greeting from the children of the elect sister.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "The elder unto the elect lady and her _______, whom I love in the truth."
questions.explanation: The elder addresses the elect lady and her children, whom he loves in the truth.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "For the truth's sake, which dwelleth in us, and shall be with us for _______."
questions.explanation: The truth dwells in us and shall be with us forever.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "I rejoiced greatly that I found of thy children walking in _______, as we have received a commandment from the Father."
questions.explanation: The elder rejoiced that the children were walking in truth.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "And this is love, that we walk after his ______. This is the commandment, That, as ye have heard from the beginning, ye should walk in it."
questions.explanation: Love is defined as walking after God's commandments.

questions.question: Who is described as the 'elder' in the opening of 2 John?
questions.explanation: The elder is traditionally understood to be John the Apostle, the author of this epistle.

questions.question: What is the central theme emphasized throughout 2 John?
options: Faithfulness to the true doctrine of Christ and love
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness to the true doctrine of Christ and love
questions.explanation: The letter emphasizes abiding in the truth, love, and warning against deceivers denying Christ's incarnation.

questions.question: Which phrase best summarizes the elder's warning about deceivers in 2 John?
options: "Many deceivers who deny Jesus Christ's incarnation"
"Beware of false prophets who preach circumcision"
"Reject those who do not keep the Sabbath"
questions.correctAnswer: "Many deceivers who deny Jesus Christ's incarnation"
questions.explanation: The elder warns of deceivers who do not confess that Jesus came in the flesh.

questions.question: What does the elder pray will be full when he comes to speak face to face?
questions.explanation: He hopes their joy may be full when he visits and speaks face to face.

questions.question: What does the elder mean by 'receive him not into your house' in 2 John 1:10?
options: Do not offer hospitality to false teachers
Do not invite strangers to meals
Do not attend meetings in private homes
Do not rent houses to non-believers
questions.correctAnswer: Do not offer hospitality to false teachers
questions.explanation: The instruction is to avoid giving support or hospitality to those who bring false doctrine.

questions.question: According to 2 John, what is the relationship between love and obedience to commandments?
options: Love is expressed by walking after God's commandments
Love is only emotion, not action
questions.correctAnswer: Love is expressed by walking after God's commandments
questions.explanation: True love is demonstrated by obedience to God's commandments.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "Whosoever transgresseth, and abideth not in the doctrine of Christ, hath not ______."
questions.explanation: Those who do not abide in Christ's doctrine do not have God.

questions.question: How does the elder describe the children of the elect lady in terms of their spiritual walk?
questions.explanation: The children are described as walking in truth, which brings the elder joy.

questions.question: What does the elder say about many things he has to write to the elect lady?
options: He will write a long letter
He prefers to come and speak face to face
questions.correctAnswer: He prefers to come and speak face to face
questions.explanation: Instead of writing at length, the elder hopes to visit and speak personally.

questions.question: Which of these best describes the tone of 2 John?
questions.explanation: The letter is pastoral, loving but firm in warning against false teachings.

questions.question: Why does the elder ask the elect lady to 'look to yourselves' in 2 John 1:8?
options: So they do not lose their labor and receive full reward
questions.correctAnswer: So they do not lose their labor and receive full reward
questions.explanation: The warning is to guard against losing what they have worked for spiritually.

questions.question: True or False: The elder identifies deceivers who confess that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh.
questions.explanation: Deceivers are those who do not confess Jesus Christ has come in the flesh.

questions.question: True or False: The elder says that whoever abides in the doctrine of Christ has both the Father and the Son.
questions.explanation: Abiding in Christ's doctrine means having both God the Father and the Son.

questions.question: Which greeting does the elder send from the children of the elect sister?
questions.explanation: The children of the elect sister greet and conclude with 'Amen.'

questions.question: What is the elder's hope for the elect lady and her children when he visits?
options: That their joy may be full
questions.correctAnswer: That their joy may be full
questions.explanation: He hopes his visit will make their joy complete.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "If there come any unto you, and bring not this _______, receive him not into your house."
questions.explanation: The elder warns against receiving anyone who brings a different doctrine.

questions.question: What is the elder's attitude toward the truth in this letter?
options: He sees it as central and abiding in believers
He considers it secondary to love
questions.correctAnswer: He sees it as central and abiding in believers
questions.explanation: Truth is a key theme, dwelling in believers and to be maintained.

questions.question: What does the elder say about those who 'biddeth him God speed' to false teachers?
options: They are partakers of his evil deeds
questions.correctAnswer: They are partakers of his evil deeds
questions.explanation: Supporting false teachers makes one a sharer in their evil deeds.

questions.question: True or False: The elder writes to warn the elect lady about deceivers who deny the humanity of Christ.
questions.explanation: Deceivers are those who deny Jesus Christ came in the flesh, denying His true humanity.
